com.esri.mo2.sys.tp
Class ThreadPool

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.sys.tp.ThreadPool
public class ThreadPool
extends Object

This class manages a pool of worker Threads that are maintained to avoid the overhead of frequently instantiating new Thread objects. You can request that a particular task be performed, by calling the execute method and specifying a Task that will be associated with the pooled Thread.

The Task is placed in a Queue and when a pooled Thread becomes available, the Task's run method is invoked. The run method should perform the task, catch and handle all Exceptions that may occur, and then return. If the Task's run method does not handle Exceptions properly, then the default behaviour is to print a stack trace and for the pool thread to resume.

You can run a task after another task has completed. To use this feature, the Tasks associated with your task should be short-lived objects. The reference to the Tasks will be meaningless, should the same Task be tasked more than once.

The advantage of managing threads in this manner, is it provides an effective way of limiting the total number of application threads. Indiscriminate thread construction can result in thread resources being over used, causing loss of performance consequently.

setReservation

public void setReservation(Object reservee,
                           int count)
This method reserves a certain number of Threads to be guaranteed available when the given reservee object is referenced in one of the execute methods. You can modify the reservation as many times as needed.

In order for this system to work, when using one of the execute methods, the reservation object must also be specified by a Task's getReservee method.

Specifying "0" for the count is equivalent to calling the removeReservation method.

Parameters:
reservee - the object used to reference this reservation
count - the minimum number of threads to reserve
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if reservee is null or count is negative
See Also:
Task.getReservee(), removeReservation(java.lang.Object)

getReservationCount

public int getReservationCount(Object reservee)
Returns the number of threads reserved for the given reservation object.

Parameters:
reservee - the reservation object
Returns:
the reservation count for given reservee object, or null

removeReservation

public void removeReservation(Object reservee)
Cancels a reservation. This method is ignored if the given reservee is null or has no prior reservation.

Parameters:
reservee - the reservation object

setFreeThreadCount

public void setFreeThreadCount(int count)
Sets the number of free threads.

Parameters:
count - the new maximum number
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if count is non-positive
See Also:
setReservation(java.lang.Object, int)

modifyFreeThreadCount

public void modifyFreeThreadCount(int increment)
This method modifies the total count of free threads by the given increment. The increment may be positive or negative value.

Parameters:
increment - the increment/decrement value to the total free thread count
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the increment would cause the free thread count to become non-positive
See Also:

getInUse

public int getInUse(Object reservee)
Returns the number of threads associated with the given reservee object. If the reservee object is null, then this method returns the number of threads not associated with ANY reservee objects.

Parameters:
reservee - the reservation object
Returns:
the number of threads

getFreeThreadsInUse

public int getFreeThreadsInUse()
This method returns the total number of free threads being executed, minus the count of threads that have been reserved.

Returns:
the number of threads

executeAsap

public void executeAsap(Task task)
Executes the given task as soon as possible. This task is given priority and will be placed at the head of the task queue.

Parameters:
task - the Task that will be run within the pooled Thread
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
See Also:
execute(Task)

execute

public void execute(Task task)
Executes the given task.

The task will be placed at the end of the task queue. When a pooled Thread becomes available, the Task's run method will be called within the Thread.

Parameters:
task - the Task that will be run within the pooled Thread
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null

executeAfter

public void executeAfter(Task task,
                         Task target)
Executes a task after another (target) task has completed. If the target task is null or is not currently running then the given task will be handled the same way as execute(Task).

Parameters:
task - the Task that will be run within the pooled Thread
target - the Task which must complete before the given task is executed, else null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if task is null
See Also:
execute(Task)
